page.title: 20Amenities
page.content: The bus services to the villages are run by Barton Transport, Midland Fox and Lincolnshire Road Car Company. There are 12 buses which go through Frisby village each week-day,11 which travel along the main A607 and 16 call at Kirby.The Sunday service is less frequent,with no timetabled buses going through the village. In 1985, there are links with the U.S.A.,through the Frisbie/Frisbee Family Association _comprising of members who can trace their family name to that of villages named Frisby. Some of the disadvantages of village life we discussed were the lack of medical facilities,a play area and large shops.Despite being surrounded by fields,we are not allowed to play in them.A car is almost essential to take advantage of the amenities offered by the nearby town of Melton.
